no.uit.ods.beaconme

Class BeaconClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.uit.ods.beaconme.BeaconClient

  • public class BeaconClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The BeaconClient is an API which handles all communication between a HTTP server and any user of this class. All POST requests are verified at the server by session tokens. Session tokens are automatically handled by this very class.

    Before calling any methods, the caller MUST set a username and password by setUser.

    Since:
    2015-02-26
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Vegard Strand

      • connectToServer

        public int connectToServer()
        Establishes a first time connection to the server. The server expects to authenticate the user with a password and a username.

        On successful authentication the server returns a session token which is stored internally in this very class. The token is used to validate all commands that changes data. (Note: the caller of these methods does not have to worry about token expiration etc. This is handled automatically)

        Returns:
        An integer representing the HTTP status of the request. See http://w3.org/Protocols for a list of available HTTP statuses. This method only returns 401 Unauthorized or 200 OK.

        Unauthorized means that either the username or password is blank or incorrect.

      • getBeacons

        public JSONArray getBeacons(java.lang.String mac,
                            java.lang.String uuid,
                            int category_id,
                            java.lang.String bcn_url,
                            java.lang.String name)
        Returns a JSONArray of beacons. The caller can search on any of the given parameters. If you don't wan't to search on an attribute, leave Strings as empty ("") and integers to 0.
        Parameters:
        mac -
        uuid -
        category_id -
        bcn_url -
        name -
        Returns:
        null on error, JSONArray with beacons otherwise

      • setBeacon

        public int setBeacon(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String uuid,
                     java.lang.String bcn_url,
                     int category_id,
                     java.lang.String mac)
        Updates the beacon on mac address. Any other attributes are optional and should be left empty ("" for Strings and 0 for integers).
        Parameters:
        uuid -
        bcn_url -
        category_id -
        mac -
        name -
        Returns:
        An integer representing the HTTP status of the request. See http://w3.org/Protocols for a list of available HTTP statuses. This method only returns 401 Unauthorized, 500 Internal Server Error, or 200 OK.

      • getCategories

        public JSONArray getCategories()
        Fetches all categories (id, subject) from server. Returns data as JSONArray.
        Returns:
        JSONArray with all categories, null on error.
